Pre-Game Insights: The match is set to take place at Parc des Princes in Paris, with a capacity of 48,229, expected to be fully packed with fans.

Both teams are aiming to bounce back from their respective disappointing performances in Euro 2024, with France looking to recover after a loss to Spain in the semi-finals, and Italy seeking redemption after being eliminated by Switzerland in the Round of 16.
Sandro Scharer from Switzerland will officiate the match, while both teams have key player absences due to injuries, including Wesley Fofana for France and Gianluca Scamacca for Italy.
France has a slight historical edge in recent head-to-head encounters, winning three out of the last five meetings, while Italy's last competitive win against France dates back to 2008.

France's recent form has been inconsistent, with wins against Portugal and Belgium, but losses to Spain and draws against Poland and the Netherlands, while Italy has struggled with two victories in their last five games, including losses to Spain and Switzerland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is the opening game of the UEFA Nations League, Round 1, and both teams are looking to make a strong start in the tournament.
